New Records: Adolis Garcia had the most RBI in any single postseason series with 15.
Key Match Events: Adolis Garcia went 4-for-5 with two singles and two homers.
Corey Seager went 3-for-5, finishing a triple shy of the cycle.
Neither starting pitcher lasted beyond the third inning.
The teams combined to use 13 pitchers.
Corey Seager launched a 440-foot homer in the first inning.
Adolis Garcia hit a leadoff homer in the third inning.
Evan Carter walked and stole second in the first inning.
Mitch Garver singled to left, scoring Garcia in the first inning.
Jose Altuve led off the bottom of the first with a double.
Alex Bregman hit a one-out blast to left-center in the third inning.
Evan Carter's double to right scored two runs in the fourth inning.
Adolis Garcia's single to left plated two runners in the fourth inning.
Nathaniel Lowe swatted a homer to right in the sixth inning.
Jose Altuve hit a homer to left in the ninth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: General manager Chris Young expressed excitement and confidence in the team.
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Young said, 'These guys have earned it. They deserve it, and we want to go get four more (wins).'
Travis Jankowski expressed joy and pride in the team's performance.
Bruce Bochy praised the team's heart and determination.
Travis Jankowski said, 'This is something you dream of as a kid, to be able to play in a World Series.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers won their third pennant and their first since 2011.
The Rangers will have home field advantage in the World Series for the first time.
